title: Use Cases in Academic Settings
text:
Flourish is widely used in academia for data analysis, research visualization, and storytelling. Here are some practical applications:







Statistical Findings – Present research data using interactive charts.


Survey Analysis – Visualize survey responses with bar charts, heatmaps, and word clouds.


Longitudinal Studies – Showcase changes over time with animated race charts.








Flourish provides map-based visualizations that are helpful for:




Climate Change Analysis – Use choropleth maps to track environmental data.


Population Density Mapping – Analyze demographic trends.


Deforestation Tracking – Monitor forest loss with geospatial data.










Historical Event Timelines – Create interactive history lessons.


Mathematical Concept Demonstrations – Explain equations with dynamic graphs.


Economics Charts – Visualize financial trends for better understanding.








Students can integrate Flourish into their academic work for:



Capstone Projects – Use data-driven storytelling for final-year research.


Research Papers – Embed dynamic visuals as evidence.


Academic Competitions – Enhance presentations with engaging charts.







Flourish helps researchers in social sciences by:




Analyzing Literary Trends – Use word clouds and text analysis tools.


Tracking Social Movements – Visualize historical and modern activism.


Cultural Data Mapping – Explore relationships between demographics and cultural shifts.




Next: Learn about Installation & Setup!
Check out the Installation Guide

title: Scatter Plot: Advertisement Budget vs Sales
text:
This document provides a step-by-step guide to creating a Scatter Plot to visualize the relationship between advertisement spending and sales performance.






Step 1




Search and click on the template of Scatter Plot in Flourish.








Step 2




Go to Flourish.


Create a new visualization and select Scatter Plot.


Upload the CSV file you downloaded.








Step 3




Set Advertisement Budget on the X-axis.


Set Sales on the Y-axis.


Adjust the scale if necessary.








Step 4




Choose a color gradient to represent different sales values.


Add labels and tooltips for better readability.


Adjust dot size and transparency for clarity.








Step 5




Click “Publish & Export” in Flourish.


Copy the Embed URL.

















Helps identify correlations between advertisement budget and sales.


Highlights outliers and potential trends in the data.


Useful for predictive analysis in marketing strategies.



This guide provides a structured approach to creating a Scatter Plot that visually represents the impact of advertising on sales.

title: Radar Chart Tutorial
text:
In this tutorial, we will create a Radar Chart to compare the football skills of Cristiano Ronaldo and Lionel Messi in five key attributes.


The data has been sourced from FIFA Index, a reliable database of FIFA player ratings.




Ball Control

Dribbling

Physical

Shooting

Passing








Step 1



Visit FIFA Index to collect the latest player statistics.

Extract values for Ball Control, Dribbling, Physical, Shooting, and Passing.

Structure the dataset as follows:






Player


Ball Control


Dribbling


Physical


Shooting


Passing






Cristiano Ronaldo


90


85


88


95


80




Lionel Messi


94


96


72


91


92












Step 1



Open Flourish and create a new Radar Chart.

Upload the dataset as an Excel or CSV file.








Step 2



Set Player Name as the Legend.

Assign attributes (Ball Control, Dribbling, etc.) to the Radar Axes.








Step 3



Adjust line thickness and colors for better contrast.

Enable tooltips to display attribute values.

Add a title and labels for clarity.








Step 4



Click Publish & Export.

Copy the Embed URL.














Displays multi-dimensional data in a single view.

Helps compare strengths and weaknesses across attributes.

Useful for sports analytics & player performance comparisons.


Your radar chart is now ready to be shared!

title: Pictograph Tutorial
text:
We’ll be using a BMI dataset from Harshal’s high school project on Obesity for the National Children’s Science Congress 2019-20. Follow these steps to create a pictograph comparing BMI categories and the number of people.




- Open Flourish and select Pictogram Chart.
- Upload your dataset (Excel or CSV format).
- Ensure that the relevant columns (BMI Category and Number of People) are correctly selected.





- Choose an appropriate icon to represent each unit (e.g., person silhouette).
- Adjust the size, spacing, and arrangement of the icons.





- Assign BMI categories to labels.
- Set Number of People as the value determining icon count.
- Ensure the mapping accurately reflects the dataset.





- Adjust colors, labels, and tooltip settings for clarity.
- Choose a consistent color scheme for different BMI categories.
- Ensure the chart is visually intuitive and accessible.





- Review your visualization for accuracy.
- Click Publish & Export in Flourish.
- Copy and share the Embed URL.






  





A Pictograph is ideal for BMI data because:

It visually represents different BMI categories (Underweight, Normal, Overweight, Obese).

Each symbol corresponds to a fixed number of individuals, making data interpretation easier.

It allows for quick comparisons between different BMI groups.

Works best for datasets where values represent grouped counts rather than percentages.

Your pictograph is now ready to be shared! 🚀

title: Line Chart Tutorial
text:
Learn how to create a Line Chart to visualize Google’s stock price trends from 2020 to 2024.







Step 1



Download historical stock data from:

Yahoo Finance

Google Finance


Ensure the dataset contains Date and Stock Price and Close columns.








Step 2



Open Flourish.
Click “New Visualization” and choose Line Chart.
Upload the dataset.








Step 3



X-axis → Date
Y-axis → Close
Enable tooltips for interactive insights.








Step 4



Adjust colors for clarity.
Enable gridlines and labels.
Add a title and description.








Step 5



Click “Publish & Export”.
Copy the embed code to share.














Clearly illustrates trends over time.

Allows comparison of price fluctuations.

Helps identify patterns in market movements.

Provides a simple yet powerful financial visualization.

title: Installation & Setup of Flourish
text:
Flourish is a web-based tool, meaning no installation is required. However, setting up an account and getting started involves a few simple steps.







Visit the official website: Flourish.studio


Click on Sign Up and enter your details.


Choose a Free or Pro Plan based on your requirements.


Verify your email and log in.










Click on New Visualization in your dashboard.


Select a template that best fits your data.


Click Upload Data and add your CSV or Excel file.


Map your columns to chart elements for proper visualization.








Flourish provides a variety of pre-built templates for different visualizations.




Explore a wide range of templates to suit your data visualization needs.

Visit Flourish Templates








Customize your visualization with colors, labels, and interactions.


Click Publish to generate a public or private link.


Copy the embed code to use on websites or presentations.





Flourish makes data visualization accessible to everyone with its user-friendly, no-code approach.
Now that you’ve set up Flourish, you’re ready to create stunning, interactive charts!


Next: Learn about Flourish’s Key Features!

Check out the Key Features

title: Conclusion: The Power of Flourish
text:
Flourish is more than just a data visualization tool—it is a game-changer for interactive and engaging storytelling. Throughout this guide, we explored its key features, applications, and installation process. Now, let’s reflect on why Flourish is an essential platform in the world of data visualization.







Simplicity & Accessibility – No coding required, making it ideal for users of all skill levels.


Diverse Visualization Options – From bar charts to complex network graphs, Flourish offers extensive templates.


Seamless Interactivity – Enables dynamic storytelling with animations, tooltips, and multi-slide narratives.


Embeddable & Shareable – Easily integrates into websites, reports, and presentations.


Real-Time Data Support – Connects with live sources like Google Sheets for up-to-date visualizations.








Flourish plays a crucial role in academia by simplifying the process of data analysis and presentation. Researchers and students can use it to:



Analyze complex datasets with interactive elements.


Create engaging reports for projects and publications.


Visualize trends and patterns for better comprehension.


Share findings with peers and educators in an impactful manner.







As data-driven decision-making becomes more prevalent across industries, tools like Flourish will continue to evolve. Whether in journalism, business, or academia, interactive storytelling is shaping the way we consume and interpret information.




Flourish is an excellent tool for anyone looking to enhance their data visualization skills. Its intuitive interface, rich feature set, and seamless integration make it a must-have for professionals and students alike.







If you want to dive deeper into Flourish’s potential, visit the official documentation and tutorials:



Flourish Official Site


Flourish Help Center




We hope this guide has been insightful in helping you unlock the power of Flourish!

title: Bar Race Chart Tutorial
text:
We’ll be creating a Bar Race Chart to visualize how the GDP of different countries has changed over time.




- Open Flourish and under the template section, click on Bar Race Chart.





- Download the dataset containing GDP (in Billion USD) over multiple years. - Upload your cleaned dataset.
- Ensure that it has columns for Country, Year, and GDP Value.
- Clean and format the data if necessary.





- Set Country as the category.
- Set Year as the time variable.
- Set GDP Value as the numerical field.
- Adjust the speed and duration of the animation.





- Choose a color scheme to differentiate countries.
- Enable labels and tooltips for better clarity.
- Adjust the font size, title, and axis settings.





- Click Publish & Export in Flourish.
- Copy the Embed URL.














A Bar Race Chart is the best choice for this dataset because:

It shows dynamic changes in GDP rankings over time.

Highlights global economic trends in an engaging way.

Animation helps track how countries rise or fall in economic power.

Makes it easy to compare GDP values year by year.

You’re done! Your animated bar race chart is ready to be shared.

title: Grouped Column Chart Tutorial
text:
Learn how to create a Grouped Column Chart using Flourish.




We are using the Food Delivery Time Prediction dataset, which contains order time, distance, and delivery duration.




Download the dataset from
Kaggle.



Dataset Preview







Go to Flourish.

Click “New visualization” → Choose Column Chart




Flourish Interface







X-axis → Time of Day

Y-axis → Time & Distance

Group by → Delivery Type




Settings Panel







Adjust colors, labels, and grid lines for better readability.




Styled Chart







Click “Export & Publish”.
Embed the chart on your website.




Final Chart











Compares multiple variables like time and distance in deliveries.

Helps analyze patterns by time of day for delivery efficiency.

title: Introduction to Flourish
text:
Flourish is an advanced no-code platform designed for creating
interactive and dynamic data visualizations. It allows users to transform raw data into
stunning visual stories without requiring programming skills.







Easy-to-use Interface – Upload datasets and instantly generate interactive charts, maps, and infographics.


Customization – Modify colors, labels, and animations to match your brand or presentation style.


Data-Driven Storytelling – Combine multiple visualizations into seamless, engaging stories.


Embeddable & Shareable – Export visualizations for web use or share them via interactive links.


Templates & Themes – A variety of pre-built templates make designing effortless.








Flourish is widely used by journalists, researchers, educators, and businesses
for data-driven decision-making.


Whether you’re analyzing climate trends,
financial reports, or social media metrics,
Flourish helps visualize complex information in an intuitive way.





With Flourish, users can:

Upload structured data (CSV, Excel, or Google Sheets).

Map data to chart elements for visual representation.

Animate changes over time to create engaging narratives.

Embed dashboards into websites or presentations.




Flourish revolutionizes how we communicate insights,
making data not just informative but also visually compelling.
In the following sections, we will explore how to use Flourish effectively
and unlock its full potential.







This is how the Flourish dashboard looks:








To create a visualization in Flourish, follow these steps:


Upload your dataset – Provide structured data in CSV or Excel format.


Choose a chart type – Select from bar charts, scatter plots, maps, and more.


Customize the design – Adjust colors, labels, and interactivity options.


Publish and share – Embed your visualizations in websites or presentations.



Here’s an example of a chart being created:






Next: Learn about Flourish’s Key Features.

Check out the Key Features

title: Key Features of Flourish
text:
Flourish provides an intuitive and powerful environment for data-driven storytelling. Here are its most significant features:


Flourish offers pre-built interactive templates for various chart types, including:
- Bar charts, line charts, and scatter plots for statistical analysis.
- Choropleth maps and point maps for geospatial visualizations.
- Animated race charts for dynamic data representation.
- Network graphs and hierarchy visualizations for complex relationships.






Unlike traditional visualization tools that require JavaScript (like D3.js), Flourish allows users to:
- Upload structured data (CSV, Excel, Google Sheets).
- Map columns to chart elements without writing any code.
- Generate compelling visuals in just a few clicks.






One of Flourish’s most powerful features is its ability to create narrative-driven visualizations. Users can:
- Create multi-slide stories that animate changes in data over time.
- Use interactive filters and buttons to enhance engagement.
- Combine multiple visualizations into a seamless report.


  




Flourish allows extensive customization:
- Modify colors, labels, and fonts to match brand identity.
- Add custom tooltips and interactive elements.
- Use advanced styling options for a professional look.






Flourish makes it easy to share visualizations:
- Export as high-quality images or PDFs for reports.
- Generate embed codes for websites and blogs.
- Integrate with third-party platforms like WordPress or Google Data Studio.






Flourish supports live data connections, meaning you can:
- Link Google Sheets or CSV URLs for real-time updates.
- Automatically refresh visualizations without re-uploading data.
- Stream data from APIs (available in the Pro version).




Flourish is a powerful yet simple tool that democratizes data visualization. Whether you’re a journalist, researcher, student, or business analyst, it enables you to present data in an engaging and interactive way.


Go back to Introduction

title: Map Visualization Tutorial
text:
We’ll be creating a Map Visualization to represent SO₂ levels across different locations in India.





- Open Flourish and select 3D Map > Heat Map.
- Upload your dataset.





- Load the dataset and extract relevant columns:
- Latitude
- Longitude
- SO₂ Concentration (µg/m³)
- Ensure the data is cleaned and formatted correctly.





- In the points section, set the ‘Appearance’ as points.
- Set Latitude and Longitude as location points.
- Set SO₂ Concentration as the circle size to represent pollution levels.
- Choose a color scale to indicate severity (e.g., yellow for low, red for high).





- Adjust circle opacity, size scaling, and tooltips for clarity.
- Add a legend to show the pollution scale.
- Set an appropriate base map style.





- Click “Publish & Export” in Flourish.
- Copy the Embed URL.













Represents pollution hotspots geographically.

Clear size scaling shows pollution severity at each location.

Provides a spatial understanding of SO₂ distribution across India.

Makes trends in urban vs rural pollution more visible.

text:
- In the points section, set the ‘Appearance’ as points.
- Set Latitude and Longitude as location points.
- Set SO₂ Concentration as the circle size to represent pollution levels.
- Choose a color scale to indicate severity (e.g., yellow for low, red for high).

title: Map Visualization Tutorial
text:
- Adjust circle opacity, size scaling, and tooltips for clarity.
- Add a legend to show the pollution scale.
- Set an appropriate base map style.

title: Map Visualization Tutorial
text:
- Click “Publish & Export” in Flourish.
- Copy the Embed URL.

title: Map Visualization Tutorial
text:
Represents pollution hotspots geographically.

Clear size scaling shows pollution severity at each location.

Provides a spatial understanding of SO₂ distribution across India.

Makes trends in urban vs rural pollution more visible.

title: Pie Chart: Market Share of Smartphone Vendors
text:
Learn how to create a Pie Chart to visualize the market share of different smartphone vendors over time.







Step 1



Download the dataset from reliable open sources.
Ensure the dataset includes Vendors, Market Share (%), and Year.








Step 2



Open Flourish.
Click “New Visualization” and choose Pie Chart.
Upload the cleaned dataset.








Step 3



Labels → Vendors
Values → Market Share (%)
Filters → Enable Year as a dropdown or slider.








Step 4



Adjust colors for better clarity.
Enable percentage labels for readability.
Add a title and description.








Step 5



Click “Publish & Export” in Flourish.
Copy the embed code to share.














Easy comparison of different smartphone vendors.
Clearly represents proportions within the total market.
Helps visualize brand dominance over time.
Useful for business analysis and market trend tracking.

Now you have an interactive Pie Chart displaying smartphone market share trends!

title: References & Further Reading
text:
Below are some valuable resources that were referenced throughout this project, including datasets and official documentation.





Flourish Official Documentation
Flourish YouTube Channel
Kaggle
Government Of India Datasets
Statcounter





The following datasets were sourced from Kaggle and other open data platforms for demonstrating Flourish’s capabilities:

Radar Dataset – [https://www.fifaindex.com/player/20801/cristiano-ronaldo/fifa16/]
Food Delivery Times – [https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/denkuznetz/food-delivery-time-prediction]
SO2 Concentrations – [https://www.data.gov.in/resource/real-time-air-quality-index-various-locations]
Mobile Vendor Market Share India – [https://gs.statcounter.com/vendor-market-share/mobile/india/2024]
Country Dataset – [https://github.com/dr5hn/countries-states-cities-database/blob/master/csv/countries.csv]
TV Marketing and Sales – [https://www.kaggle.com/datasets/samarthpujari/tv-marketing]
Google Share Price – [https://finance.yahoo.com/quote/GOOG/history/?guccounter=1]
BMI Dataset (Created by Harshal for his high school project)





We extend our sincere gratitude to Professor Nipun Batra for his guidance throughout the project and to our Teaching Assistant Dewansh Chandel for his valuable support and feedback.
This project would not have been possible without the open datasets and tools that enabled us to explore data visualization with Flourish.
